Reviews.Title: A good but not great set
Reviews.Author: Nerrel
Reviews.Content: LG's lower-mid level sets have earned a reputation for having low gaming lag, great color accuracy, and the most extensive picture options of any sets at or even above their price level. The CS560 series still delivers in these regards, but to a lesser extent than past models.The styling and build quality of the set are fairly good overall. My panel is a S-IPS type, though LG may be conducting a panel lottery (randomly shipping VA and IPS panels for the same model) as they have in the past. The buttons are front mounted and touch sensitive, which seems like a nice feature at first but makes operating the set awkward and frustrating in a dark room- don't lose the remote. Another complaint is that the set buzzes audibly unless the backlight is fully set to 100, which can be annoying when using the set quietly at night.The input lag for video gaming keeps with LG's standard for fast processing time. In the stopwatch lag tests I've done (in 1080p) the CS560 matched the response time of the Wii U's gamepad exactly, putting it in the 1-2 frames range.  There is hardly any noticeable increase in lag when upscaling from 480p and I can play timing intensive games and online FPS with no problem. If you're buying a set for use with modern games, there are few if any faster sets available than this.The color accuracy also seems to live up to LG's usual standards, although it's hard to know precisely how well without measuring with a meter. Every color is vivid and deep without appearing over saturated. The black levels are average at best, but the unbelievably bright white levels help to offset them and create contrast during bright scenes. The set is capable of 4:4:4 chroma sub sampling when used as a PC monitor over HDMI, but, as with other reviewers, it required an EDID override in my computer's registry. Regardless of the source used, the overall picture is extremely clear, vivid and detailed.The motion handling is mixed, but at least partly excellent with no visible streaking and only very light blur on moving objects during camera pans. There is, unfortunately, a large problem with juddering from most video sources, notably blu-rays at 24p. Almost any time the camera is panning the scenery and objects on screen will move in a jerky, strobe-like fashion. Past LG sets were able to handle 24p content smoothly, even models at much lower price points, so this obviously comes as a disappointment. If you intend to use the set mainly for watching blu-rays then you may want to buy the 2011 LK450 model instead.The feature set is another startling disappointment. The TV only has 4 inputs- 2 HDMI, 1 RF, 1 analog input, and no VGA or audio outputs whatsoever. To reiterate, there is no audio output, not even optical; once the audio goes into this set, the only way it can come out through the speakers. The analog video input functions as a joint component/composite input, meaning that you can't use both cable types at the same time. Users with more than two sources will find themselves having to use adapters or receivers to handle most of their connections.The HDMI inputs also have occasional problems connecting to sources.  Rarely the set will display "no signal" even when a device is connected and powered on, and other times the hue of the image will  shift toward an extreme red or green.  These problems can be solved by changing the input to something else, then changing back, or powering the set off and on again, but it's disappointing that the HDMI inputs have any defects at all considering that they've been given priority over the other input types.Some of the advanced picture options have also been cut, giving the CS560 the most limited menu of any recent LG (though the range of options is still fuller than any competing set).  The more pointless features such as "eye care" have been omitted, but some useful calibration tools have also been removed; there is no longer a color filter option, which means that color and tint calibration now require a pair of blue glasses to set. The 10-point IRE calibration has also been removed, leaving only the option for 2-point.  The picture wizard seems to have defective patterns for brightness and contrast, yielding white and black levels that are wildly off target and impossible to match correctly (Update: The Picture Wizard has been fixed through a firmware upgrade and now calibrates correctly).My opinion of the 560 is that it's an excellent looking TV but one that grinds right along the border of "minimal" and "cheap". The features of the set have been scaled back significantly compared to past models in response to the advance of LED, which seems poised to become the default backlight technology of LG's TV lineup. If you have simple tastes and just want a good looking set for gaming and occasional movie watching, the 560 is a great value and will perform well enough. If you're a more serious film enthusiast with a large blu-ray collection, then you may want to seek out an LK450 or choose a different brand to avoid the judder and limited inputs.

Reviews.Title: They stripped a lot of features out for 2012 over the same 2011 model
Reviews.Author: finally_cool_in_ks
Reviews.Content: Review written by K.WatsonThey stripped a lot of features out for 2012 over the same 2011/2010 line/models. The reasons are unclear. I assume to just make more money and fleece their customers even more. They removed so many great features that really made this a great set but they kept the price the same, which I would like to point out is already high compared to other models in the size. There is just no sense or logic in the stripping of these features whatsoever.They removed a HDMI port. Now there are not enough ports to hook up everything you need. Deal breaker for most potential customers right there. With just 2 ports, I've already had to pull out my set away from the wall several times to juggle between consoles, or if I want to watch a bluray movie or if I want to watch cable. It's a hassle. God only knows why LG would remove a very much needed HDMI port from us. Even the guy at Best Buy told us that he does not recommend this set to anyone because it has the least amount of HDMI ports of all their sets. He seemed really shocked. So were we.Movie quality is now worse. They removed 5:5 / 2:2 pull down from movies. Actually, ANY video content you want to display. 480, 720 or 1080. This means there is a huge amount of video judder / jitter present in any movie you watch. Go google "judder" it's a bad thing and you don't want it. But, if you buy this set, you will have plenty of it. Judder makes objects on the screen herky jerky when panning left to right, right to left, any panning whatsoever. Up / down, you name it. Objects will skip along the screen. God only knows why LG took this very basic feature out. It basically ruined this set. Even my daughter noticed the judder in her Disney movies and asked if the game needed cleaning. She is still at that age where she doesn't understand fully about bluray or dvd discs and thought that if Daddy and Mommy cleaned her "game" the movie would display smoothly. Of course it wasn't a game but a Bluray disc.They took out many many features from the user menu. Gone are many features that could be changed in the 2010 and 2011 version of this set / product line. Basically, at the expense of picture quality. Dozens of features were removed. They absolutely sabotaged this set and mangled what it once was. I know, I own both the LG 32KD450 and LG 32LK450. I apologize if I am being so harsh but LG warrants such a response and I think potential LG customers deserve an in-depth review.The night I returned my set to Best Buy, the sales person looked at me, puzzled I might add and asked me, what is so bad about this set? He went on to say two other people had returned theirs as well over the weekend.What a shame that LG would ruin such a fantastic line of TV sets by removing so many features that made this such a stand out TV against other 32" sets from other manufactures. Let's just hope that LG discontinues this model next year instead of releasing this kind of garbage upon it's customers. What I really want to ask LG is, why did you not want my money? Why did you remove the HDMI port and all those very important hardware features and menu features that made this such a great TV? Why LG?Update: I had a chance to speak with the sales manager from Nebraska Furniture Mart in my area and he tells me LG purposely crippled, removed these features, both hardware and in the user menu to make it's newer LED based TV's stand out against this set. He tells me that sometimes manufactures will do this to artificially highlight a TV in it's product line as having more features , better value, when the truth is, it never did. This is to drive sells in that area.I can tell you this LG. You customers are both smart and savvy and will see through this gimmick. I would also like to point out that when your customers are treated with respect, they become "loyal" customers. Pulling these kind of stunts will only drive business and customers away. I returned my set and I will not be looking at LG as a brand I would consider for anything in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price -- An Honest Review of LG 32" CS560
Reviews.Author: LivingFit365
Reviews.Content: First and foremost this TV is not for high-end videophiles, audiophiles with highly sensitive, discerning taste, or dedicated, scrutinizing gamers. If you want that type of TV, you'll need to step it up a notch and of course pay more money. This is a medium, entry level 1080P TV with a clear, crisp picture and enough features to satisfy the average TV and occasional movie viewer, mom, pop and the 'family' -- That type of consumer. Maybe, just maybe some higher-end users will enjoy this as a second TV to use when they're not watching blue-ray on the high-end, expensive TV.Some reviewers criticized this TV for not having features of previous models in this price range. Well, I never had those features and don't miss them, nor do I need them. So to a new buyer its most important that you remember if you don't need a certain feature and/or never had it to begin with and don't miss it, it's not a big deal.I consider myself a savvy shopper and critical when it comes to quality of a product. I was looking for a low-priced TV that had some decent picture and sound quality. I just purchased this TV today from a local, big-box store for well under $380 and I'm very pleased with the great picture quality and especially the low price and great value.The other thing I wanted to mention is that don't over-buy in size. Everyone seems to want to buy the biggest TV they can afford. Well let me tell you, that's not always the best thing to do. I bought this TV because it is eventually going into a bedroom. So I opted for the 32". Right now it is set up in the living room and to be honest, the size is perfect for the living room. I was considering a 40"-50" at one time, and that would have been overkill.Also, DO NOT go by the picture quality at the stores no matter how 'great' they try to make it look. It's not a true representation of the TV's picture quality, nor how it will look in 'your' home, in 'your' lighting. It is also very hard to decide on a size when all the other sizes are sitting next to one another. It's very overwhelming a one can get confused trying to figure out which size will be best.My advice is to look at your room and space and try to decide on a TV that is not too overpowering yet not too small where the room dwarfs the TV. Here is an idea ... tape together pieces of poster board the size of the TV and place it in the space intended to get a perspective on size. Actually I think a 32" is a great size for most medium-sized rooms. Once you decide the size you're looking for, go shopping. You may change your mind a little bit smaller or a little bit bigger, but at least you'll have a base line to start before you go.Okay, so now with all of that being said and out of the way, here is my review.------Pros------Esthetics (design) ---> Modern, clean lines. Thin profile, but not the thinnest and not like the older, thicker models either. This TV has about a 2" black frame around the screen. It seems these days people are interested in the paper-thin frames, or the frame-less TV's.  Actually, I 'thought' that was going to be my preference, as it is more sleek, minimalist, etc. But actually, when I got this home I really liked the fact it has a wider black frame. It accents nicely against the white walls and gives it sort of a 'picture frame' type of appeal. It makes the T.V. more of a focal point in the room. If you already have one big piece of furniture or artwork that is the main focal point of the room, then maybe a thin-frame or frame-less TV would be better in your situation.  So anyway my advice is, don't go by what is 'trendy' go by what will look good in your particular home and environment. In my home the wider frame looks very nice.There are no buttons on the front of the TV, which is nice. It has flat, flush, touch-sensitive selectors for volume, channel, menu, etc. This keeps the TV looking clean, and uncluttered. Some manufactures hide 'buttons' under the frame or on the side of the frame. The 'clicking' of buttons just seems old-fashioned to me, at least now with iPads and such, and everything going to touch panels. I actually like the touch-sensitive, flat selectors on the 'front' of this TV within clear view of what I am pressing.This TV is very lightweight. Really it is. I carried this with one hand out of the store, and easily lifted this up onto my mantel with no problem. This means if you wish to move it from one room to another it can be done by one person. This was a blessing because I can remember not too long ago the behemoth tube TV's needed 3 people to help carry and install. This TV is truly a do-it-yourself TV. Nice!Assembly---> Easy. Out of the box, all that needed to be done is screw on the base, plug in your video source and power cord and that's it! You're done. Oh and put the 'included' batteries in the remote.Picture and Audio Set Up ---> Simple and intuitive. Using the 'picture wizard' guides you step by step to calibrate the TV and adjust picture settings. There are advanced settings to fine tune the picture even more. The auto-tune feature pulls in all your cable stations into the built-in tuner fast, easy and automatically.Selecting the audio preference is just as easy. Faux surround sound, etc.. Just a few selections and you'll soon be listening to the TV to your liking.Picture Quality ---> Sharp, vivid, clear picture quality for the price. Now compare this to the 50" plasma the store had on display running Avatar on Blue-ray and this TV pales in comparison. (but so did most of the other TV's on the floor). The bigger TV was 5+ times the price of this one. So you get what you pay for. Watching ABC, CBS, NBC and other cable stations, this TV has an amazing picture that will not disappoint. Blue-ray and DVD are just as fine.Audio Quality ---> Pretty good actually. It has a faux surround mode that does a nice job of dynamically enhancing the sound. There is also a feature to enhance the voices too so they don't get lost in background music and such.  This TV does not have the tinny, AM radio sound you may expect from a low priced TV. Nor does it have the booming sound of a higher-end TV.  This TV has very acceptable and clear, crisp sound for the price. The sound easily fills the room. You won't be disappointed in the sound from built-in speakers.USB connector ---> This is a nice, added feature if friends or family come by and you'd like to watch a home video or pictures on your TV. Just plug in the USB drive and start watching.Remote Control ---> A very basic, simple, easy to use remote. You won't find a bunch of confusing bells and whistles on the remote. No it's not going to make your toast and start your car. Nope, it has just exactly what you need and nothing more.  So, the reason I like that is because I don't have to worry about family or guests trying to figure out how in the heck to turn on or operate the TV with a confusing remote. It spares me the agony of conducting a 'TV 101' classroom session for family and friends. Ugh!----Cons----Not very many cons actually. I mean for under $380 dollars for a 32" 1080P TV, you're really getting great quality and value. Seriously, technology is advancing so rapidly that in 5 to 10 years most computers and TV's are behind the times and out of date anyway. So, at this price one could easily afford to buy another mid-level TV like this one every 5 years. On the other hand, spending $1,000+ on a TV to try to get a few more bells and whistles might extend the time a bit more until it's out of date, but probably not by much. In 5-10 years you're still stuck with an out-of-date TV.Hookups ---> No VGA connector to hook up to a computer. This is only a slight con, because you can use one of the HDMI connectors if your computer has an HDMI. Most newer computers have HDMI.Some people are complaining this TV only has 2 HDMI connections. This again is only a slight con, because you can buy an HDMI 1080P hub and expand the amount of HDMI connections if you really need more.For my needs, all I really need is one HDMI to hook it up to Apple TV and one for my blue-ray player That's it. The Apple TV pretty much does everything I need. It has digital audio out, so I can hook it up to a surround sound system If I choose (expanding the capability of the TV) And what is not available on NetFlix or my purchases, I can use my Blue-ray player. I can mirror my iPad through Apple TV to have internet on my TV. So, having only 2 HDMI connections is not such a drawback, for my needs anyway.----------Conclusion----------The LG 32" CS560 is an excellent TV at a very low price. It combines a clear, crisp 1080P picture quality with impressive, built-in sound quality. For well under $380 dollars, you can't go wrong buying this TV. This TV is not going to replace a high-end theater or gaming TV for your theater room, but it will make a good living room, bedroom or family room TV. Who knows, once you buy this TV, you may decide you don't really need to spend extra bucks on a bigger, home theater TV. At such a low price, it allows a person to purchase a newer TV in 5 or 10 years without feeling like you're constantly spending tons of money to always upgrade your TV. You'll be surprised how much quality is packed into a TV at such a low price.---------------------------------If you liked this review, you may enjoy other reviews by me. Just click on the 'see all my reviews' link at the top of this review. I have more than one page of reviews and can be accessed by clicking on the page number on the lower right corner of my total review page.

Reviews.Title: Highly disappointed . . .
Reviews.Author: Racer J
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this TV expecting to get the same quality that the 32LD450 and the 32LK450 had.  While it may be the 32LK450's replacement, it certainly doesn't live up to its predecessor.  The only area of "improvement" is that they will all allegedly have IPS screens.  The one I purchased was an S-IPS (I would have chosen A-MVA if I had a choice), the other unit on the shelf had the same AUSY code, and so did the display unit.  The IPS is only an "improvement" though if you were playing the panel lottery with the 32LK450 and trying to find an IPS panel instead of the A-MVA panel.  The TV I got has a very minimal amount of backlight bleed on the bottom edge slightly to the right of the center.  It's not very noticeable with the backlight down but if you have it high, it stands out and has been getting worse.  Initially there was no banding on the DVI>HDMI signal from the PC on various test pages but, that has started to show up as well for some reason.  Speaking of tests, do not bother using the "Picture Wizard" on the TV as it will crush your black levels and it is impossible to make the which image look like the recommended example unless you increase the brightness and wash out your black levels in the process.  There is something fundamentally wrong with the "Picture Wizard" and/or the TV.Several of the options in the TV menu have been removed and are as follows:Picture Mode:APS Photo (this was model Dependant)TruMotion: This was model dependent but it's allegedly in the 32CS560 yet there is is no setting for it in the menu.Screen RBG PC: This is obviously missing as the CS560 series does not have a VGA portAdvanced Settings/Expert Control: Dynamic Colour (this is missing on Expert 1 and Expert 2) Skin Colour Digital Noise Reduction (Noise Reduction is still there) Clear White Eye Care Real Cinema/Film mode (24fps video has to be playing to gain access to this) Colour Gamut (EBU, SMPTE, and BT709 have been removed) xvYCC (I haven't seen this but, that type of signal may not be getting put out) Colour Filter Expert Pattern Color Temperature (is not available on expert and it has been changed to only go from W50 to C50. All methods except 2 point have been removed and 2 point is under the Expert Control on all video modes including Expert 1 and Expert 2. The 10 point IRE settings have been removed)Option Settings: ISM Mode (this was used to remove ghosting from stationary images and it has been removed).In addition to that, the 32CS560 does not process 24fps video content correctly.  There is a judder/jitter/stutter every time the camera pans up, down. left, or right.  You have to have "Film Mode" on to make the judder/jitter/stutter not look like a bunch of zig zags but it doesn't stop it from happening.  You need ot reduce your contrast setting to 20 or less to reduce the judder/jitter/stutter and that will seriously degrade your I/PQ (image/picture quality) as it will leave it dim/dingy/dirty/etc. as if there is a film of dirt/fog on your screen.  There is absolutely no way to correct this issue and to make matters worse, you can not use "Film Mode" when the 32CS560 is hooked up to your PC.  This issue has been reported by two other owners as well.Speaking of the PC, you are able to have the 32CS560 do 4:4:4 chroma without renaming the input label but, you have to do the EDID override if you are using a Nvidia video card.  When it comes to video games (PC and console), there aren't a lot of complaints as myself and two other owners didn't notice any issues.  When it comes to video though, the TV's flaws are there in full force just like they are with a DVD player.I will be returning this TV for a refund (purchased locally so I didn't have to wait for shipping) as I have absolutely no interest in an exchange as the issues are present with other owners.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, But Features are Lacking
Reviews.Author: DMFC
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad TV in most respects.  It has a great picture for the price and the sound quality is quite good for a LCD TV.  However, it lacks some features that may be critical for many users.Pros:Great pictureGreat sound quality (for a LCD anyways)Great Price for a 42" LCDLG Name brand (which supposedly has better customer service than most manufactures)Cons:No audio output (i.e. no way to connect to speakers)Only 2 HDMI InputsNo PC Input (unless you get a cable to convert to HDMI)Overall, it is a good TV.  If (like me) you don't really need the other features, you will be happy with it.  In my opinion, it is much better than buying a TV from an inferior brand and then being out of luck when it breaks.

Reviews.Title: 42 inch LG 42CS560
Reviews.Author: Angela Streiff
Reviews.Content: I picked this TV set up about two months ago and so far have been beyond pleased with it. It's used every day, for basic cable (through a coaxial cable), streaming movies through a Roku with Netflix and for playing Play Station 3 video games.Picture/60Hz:It's beautiful! Movies look awesome, TV looks stunning and video games look dynamic. The 60Hz refresh rate has not been an issue for me at all while playing any games on the PS3. I can't say I notice any visual distortion with any of my games, such as Modern Warfare 3, InFamous 2, Uncharted 3 and Heavy Rain. I'm a pretty avid gamer and I haven't had seen anything with the refresh rate that would make me think that I needed one with a higher rate. Maybe if the TV was lager than 42 inches, but at this size everything looks and works beautifully.Sound:The sound is great. I bought a flat screen 2 years ago that had abysmal sound. The speakers in it are so bad if you turn the volume up at all, it's almost painful to listen to. I've heard better sound come out of AM/FM radios than some of the "budget" priced TVs being sold out there now. However, I'm extremely pleased with the sound from this TV. Everything sounds clear and like it should. Nothings muffled or sounding like someone is talking into a tin can.Remote control:Like most TV's these days, it's narrow, tall and complicated. It has tons of options on it for controlling every aspect of the TV. But for the most part, once you have all the settings on the TV just how you want them, you'll be using this mostly for changing channels, volume or switching to HDMI/AV ports. What I do like is they put all the less used menu buttons on one end of the remote, and the most common ones on the other end, by your hand at the bottom. So for the most part, you can reach everything you need for basic TV watching (except for the power button) with your thumb while holding the remote.Size/weight:The 42 inch version of this TV is big and beautiful, but not so heavy it can't be moved around. Once you mount it on the included stand, it can easily be slid around and positioned any way you need it to go, without the need of a second pair of hands on the other side. When it comes to moving it from pace to place, the size itself (being such a wide TV) makes it more difficult than the weight actually does.On-TV buttons:The buttons on the TV are actually sensor buttons inside the frame. They are not above the surface, but inside it. Like that of a device with a touch screen, when you touch the area on the black frame around the TV that indicates where the power sensor is, it will recognize you touched it and power it on. Because all the buttons are like this, the black glossy TV frame looks solid and uninterrupted like a picture frame, looking completely button-less. When actually the buttons are there, but just as sensors inside the frame.Price:Hands down this is the best TV of this size that I've found, that has this beautiful of a picture and great of sound.Conclusion:After two months of daily use and seeing how well everything works, I wouldn't hesitate to buy another one of these at all. I am astounded at what a great TV it is for such a good price. If anything ever changes, I will update this review. But as of now, I really like this TV and would recommend it to anyone.Update 1/19/2013: 8 months after buying this TV I'm still loving it. Haven't had problems of any kind.

Reviews.Title: Even better than our first LG TV!
Reviews.Author: Happy Mom in Tennessee
Reviews.Content: We had bought an almost identical product, but with 720p instead of the 1080p, just a few months ago. We loved it, and we decided when the old Sony "monster" died in our family room, we would replace it with a very similar model to our new LG. Within a couple of months the decision time came. We rolled the old "giant" out to the curb and began looking through the LG's now available. My husband said if the 720p gave us the fine picture we were enjoying, the 1080p would have to be nothing short of fantastic. Amazon offered a price as low as any store in town or online, and with no tax and no shipping, their price was far less than anyone. We received the new LG in four days (regular UPS), and the set-up was quick, easy, and we were watching our new family room TV in less than an hour, box to job complete. This model is user friendly in every way, has the fantastic picture we had hoped for, and we are totally happy we ordered the LG once again. My home is beginning to fill with LG products! Our 32" is just the right size in our family room. We didn't need one of those "movie theater" screens, and I REFUSE to go in debt for a television! This screen can be seen at any point in our family room, and the picture is clear and crisp. We are completely pleased with Amazon and our LG TV.

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV for Joe SixPack
Reviews.Author: runnin in mpls
Reviews.Content: I did a great deal of research before purchasing this television.  I quickly found that there are individuals out there who key into every last detail when comparing it to other models and previous versions.  There are typically the folks who do a good deal of gaming and movie watching on their TV.I'm just an ordinary dufus who likes to plop down on the couch and watch football all weekend.  I don't need a ton of bells and whistles, I just need something that's good sized, easy to put together, has a nice picture, and that's easy to use.  This television meets all those criteria, at a great price to boot!  I was tranisitioning from a 32" tube TV which I bought in the early 2000's, so I was excited to finally get an HD TV.I ordered this item on a Friday and was fine with the slow/free shipping.  It arrived the following Wednesday.  It took me about 15 minutes to attach the stand and get things running.  I was watching Honey Boo Boo within 20 minutes of opening the box!  It's working great so far with no issues, and the picture is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Read the specs first!
Reviews.Author: Tenorman
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the picture quality of this new 37" LCD. It's the best I've ever seen, and we own 32" and 42" LCDs by other manufacturers. The the room light sensor works perfectly, compensatting for all sorts of light levels.However, I was greatly disappointed to find that this model has NO AUDIO OUTPUT CONNECTIONS whatsoever. That's right, none, not even a headphone jack. So you cannot connect any external audio equipment to enhance the viewing experience. It's beyond me why a manufacturer would skimp on something so important - and inexpensive - as this! For this raeson only I plan to return the unit and order something else - after carefully studying the specifications!So, if great picture quality is all you're after, this model will satisfy you. But it's lack of outputs is a deal killer for me.  LG 37CS560 37-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: Quilt Queen 53
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I am NOT an expert on televisions. But my son is and it was on his recommendation that I looked to LG when it was time to get my 86-year-old mother a new TV. Some on here have complained about the lack of "bells and whistles" but that was a plus in this case. The remote is very easy to use and I have it set up so that the only button she has to push on the TV remote is the "Input" button to switch from blu-ray to cable and back. The picture is amazing and Mom is happily working her way through her entire DVD movie collection because she loves the big, clear picture (she says it's like having her own movie theater) and she can now hear and understand dialogue that she's been guessing about for years, thanks to the dialogue enhancement feature. Mom spends between 4-8 hours a day in front of the TV and this has made a huge improvement in the experience for her.We did get off to a rocky start. The first unit shipped had a faulty screen and it had to be exchanged. I didn't deduct a star for that because I know that every manufacturer has one slip through the quality control process from time to time. In all fairness, it did function as advertised for an hour or so before the trouble began. I called LG and they were very helpful. They had a tech out here within 2 days and, when he couldn't fix it, he boxed the unit back up for me so that I could send it back to Amazon. Amazon was great. The return process was painless and I had the new unit the next day. They also scheduled the pick-up for the defective unit. I didn't even have to print a shipping label.So, I think this is an excellent product for a really good price, especially for someone who just wants to watch TV and movies. Set-up was a breeze. The remote is easy to understand and use. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: LCD or LED
Reviews.Author: A. Pelletier "happy funball"
Reviews.Content: When I ordered this TV I was under the impression that it was an LED TV. When the verification came through however it described it as an LCD TV. I have since discovered that this is not all that uncommon and some TVs are even described as LED/LCD TVs. (?)That said, for the price I am more than satisfied. I use this device as a computer monitor as well as to watch movies and stream from the internet and I am quite satisfied. Any time the picture has not been as sharp as I could hope it has been because of the quality of broadcast or streaming. When watching movies from my Blu-ray player or watching HD broadcasts or streams the picture is very nice.If you want an affordable HDTV with a decent picture, this is a good choice. My one caveat would be that I have heard from several sources that if you do experience any problems with the equipment that LG is very unresponsive. If I had been aware of that I might have made a different choice.

Reviews.Title: Great monitor at a great price
Reviews.Author: Yamaudio
Reviews.Content: I recently received this 42" LG unit from Amazon. It arrived in perfect condition. I unpacked it and we mounted it on the wall using a Sanus full motion mount. (I didn't use the supplied stand) The room we have it in is bright and off axis viewing is also an issue. I am happy to say that it worked out very well on both accounts.It has two HDMI ins, component, composite and a USB in as well. Plenty of connectivity for most any application. I had a question as to whether the HDMI cable supports ARC, but a quick check of the website and a chat with a tech answered the question (no by the way). Great tech support by LG.Overall, a lightweight and great looking product both off and on!My wife is very happy with it... Enough said!

Reviews.Title: For the price, one of the best 42-inchers out there
Reviews.Author: Paul Perret
Reviews.Content: The picture is pretty decent, better than I expected, actually.  Nice dark blacks, nice contrast and brightness (make sure you disable the "Energy Saver" mode if you want it to be bright enough for a well-lit room). All the adjustments you really need are available. My only gripe is that it doesn't have a ton of inputs (just two HDMI, one component, one RCA). But - like me - if that's all you need, you're good to go. Another big plus is gaming lag is minimal, which was one of my primary reasons for getting this TV. LG seems to do well in that department, and I can vouch for it, playing Rocksmith, which is very timing-dependent.  All in all, very happy with this TV for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: Great display
Reviews.Author: km
Reviews.Content: I haven't had this TV for long but so far I like it. The display is great but you have to adjust the screen to fit your taste.

Reviews.Title: so far so good.
Reviews.Author: Natalie J. Bredberg "natalie j"
Reviews.Content: had the TV for 2 weeks, and so far love it! No complaints, some people complain about 2 HDMI inputs, we just bought a 1--> 3 input, and it works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for its price
Reviews.Author: Davigdori
Reviews.Content: I have bought 6 of these for me and my friends. This is a great TV for its price. It is big enough for a normal living room and is great to watch live sport.

Reviews.Title: FIRST TIME LARGE TICKET PURCHASE A WINNER
Reviews.Author: Ed of SW Fl. "edward1948"
Reviews.Content: Purchased the item because of Brand recognition.  I was able to view the item at 2 Big Box stores and was very satisfied with the quality.  Amazon was $100 cheaper at the time even with the stores saying sale.  The price has since dropped more at the stores.  I sound is excellent I rarely go outside 15 to 20 on the volume scale.  It was very easy to get hook-up to my satelite providers remote.  5 Stars.

Reviews.Title: LG CS560 TV
Reviews.Author: tdown28
Reviews.Content: The TV is a good quality tv. I give it3 stars because this TV is not good if u want to have an audio output such as surround sound or even hook up a headset to it. Also tv comes with a USB port but that is only good for photos and music and doesnt allow you to watch videos from an external hard drive and as a deployed soldier this TV will do you NO good because as you know we all have movies on an external hard drive. Honestly who makes a tv where u cant hook up another audio device or have a usb only for photos and pictures. Great Job LG

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: Brennon Lewis
Reviews.Content: An enormous upgrade from my twenty-four inch Insignia LED.The LG CS560 has excellent color, amazing blacks, and a great sharp picture. I'm shock that the're better HDTVSSettings with Spear & Munsils and a 48 bit deep-color Hdmi(Hdmi features change results)Backlight: 67Contrast: 76(now 72)Brightness:53(night)62(day)Sharpness: Should be 40 but I use 53Color:53Tint: G7Dynamic Contrast: Off (blows out detail)Gamma: HighBlack Level: LowColor gamut: StandardEdge Enhancer: OffWhite Balance: MediumCyan color: 4Cyan Tint: 6Magenta color and Tint: 3Update:After tweaking the blue/red/green Contrast & blue/red/green brightnessI came up with a more natural background color. With the contrast and brightness on default gives off a green background which looks terrible.Red contrast: 12Green contrast:0Blue contrast: 7Red brightness:10Green brightness:-8Blue brightness: 3

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: rond50
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV for my Mom an she loves it. It has a great picture, perfect color, and good sound. Also just the right size.

Reviews.Title: LG does not stand behind its product
Reviews.Author: aude m stevance
Reviews.Content: We purchased this LG TV from Amazon on Nov 29, 2010 for $550. We also purchased an extended warranty from ServiceNet for $69.99 for 3 years (in fact 2 years because the manufacturer covers year 1). The TV started having problems in early 2012 (approximately 14 months after purchase)with a green band covering the left side of the TV (intermittent but consistent). The bottom line was that Service Net would not repair it because the repair was over $800 and LG would not repair it because I had an extended warranty and they would not repair it under LG extended warranty.Lesson to be learned - ServiceNet is limited warranty and won't cover major repairs to the TV and LG TVs are of such poor quality that they are in essence garbage after the manufacturer's warranty expires. I find it hard to believe that LG does not stand behind its product. In fact we purchased an LG TV before, it had a similar problem and Best Buy stood behind the warranty.So, here's the Catch 22 - LG won't offer extended warranty to repair their TV because I purchased an extended warranty from ServiceNet and ServiceNet won't cover the cost of repair because LG TV's are too expensive to repair.Caveat emptor..... don't buy LG42 TV's....they have a consistent problem with the panel / screen....if you do...the extended warranty through ServiceNet will do you no good if you need something major repaired.

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality, No Way to Connect to Home Theater, Soundbar
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I have owned this television for approximately four months now, and I am extremely disappointed in nearly every meaningful category. The remote is poorly designed and un-intuitive compared to most comparable products. One has to first press the "TV" button and then a separate "POWER" button every single time, which though only a minor annoyance, is hard to explain.The picture quality is very poor for an item of this price. Even from a decent distance (10-15 feet), the image is blurry. Sports and other fast-action scenes are grainy and slow to refresh. I understand that the refresh rate is only 60 HZ on this set, but I have seen similar models from other manufacturers do a far better job with the same types of images.But the real kicker is that there is no way to connect the set to any type of external speaker--no digital coaxial, no RCA audio cables out, not even a headphone jack. The very meager speakers that are part of the set are what you're stuck with... do not bother purchasing a soundbar, 2.1, or home theater system. You will have no way to connect it. On a $500 set, that's pretty inexcusable. I would strongly recommend not purchasing this model.

Reviews.Title: LG 42 CS560 DIED AFTER 7 WEEKS!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Bredernitz "OLD CHEVY"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this from Amazon...worked fine and then just quit--no power--no light. Contacted LG customer service three times, and they keep giving me the run-around. I think the power supply board failed which I read that they are notorious for... I will NEVER buy any LG product ever!!  JUNK...JUNK...CAVEAT EMPTOR...BUYER BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: 13 months... Dead
Reviews.Author: Big Bubba "G26"
Reviews.Content: It is a nice TV for a year. Weird but my luck the screen started flashing and the tv would turn self off 13 days after the limited 1 year warrenty expired.I told myself not another LG due to the one I was replacing was a 3 year old 32 inch LG LCD that the mother board gave out in and after the 1st year the TV tuner stoped working so I used it as only with hdmi.Buy this TV or I guess brand of TV if you like buying 500 dollar tvs each year and everyone else who isnt made of money such as myself RUN from LG TVs.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Kevin N Buckley
Reviews.Content: Well I bought the TV it came in two days because of prime I open end the box and their was no TV stand in the box so I had to spend extra money to buy a wall mount but other than that the TV is excellent and great vivid picture

Reviews.Title: Good Product, Good Manufacturer, Reasonable Price
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: 37" HD TVs with 1080p resolution for $400 is a rare market. LG has one the best models out there. I would definitely rate the Samsung UN37EH5000FXZA higher, and that is mainly because of the 120Hz screen refresh rate (The LG is 60Hz). Keep in mind though, the Samsung costs $100 more.LG is a highly regarded TV manufacturer, up there with Samsung, Panasonic, and Sony. Price to performance, LG is one of the safest manufacturers you can go with and their sets are generally more reasonably priced than the other top tier brands.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, sound, and menu controls. Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Jhaev
Reviews.Content: As others have pointed out, the only downside to this TV is that it only has 2 HDMI inputs and 1 component input. I don't actually need more than that so this doesn't matter to me. If it did I would have looked for a different model.Everything else is perfect. The picture is great, the sound is as good as I've heard from built-in speakers, and I actually really like the menu layout and options. Much better image controls than my last TV.I feel that at $400 this is a really good deal. I would happily recommend this TV to my personal friends.

Reviews.Title: no A-V out
Reviews.Author: Charles Cusumano "Darwin-was-right."
Reviews.Content: TV is easy to set up; picture is very good. BIG problem, speakers are c**p. There is NO AV out to run sound through an amp. Really ruins an otherwise good TV

Reviews.Title: Junk tv
Reviews.Author: Cuzeen
Reviews.Content: I did not purchase this item from amazon  but i am a not so proud owner. I had my lg tv for about a year. It was fine at first, i actually liked it alot until about a month ago. The damn thing turns on and off all by itself. Sometimes it takes up to 20 minutes to get it to turn back on at all. I googled the problem and turns out alot of people have power problems with these LG tvs. I strongly suggest buying another brand. Stay away

Reviews.Title: The contrast is horrifying
Reviews.Author: Jonny
Reviews.Content: The sound on this model is great and the price is pretty nice. But the contrast is completely awful. If you're watching anything dark at all it's impossible to see. Thor was next to impossible to watch, for instance. Batman: Arkham City was incredibly hard to play. I've had this television for less than three days and I've had a few hours already where I nearly gave up watching whatever it was in exasperation. I've played with the settings already and nothing works at all.

Reviews.Title: TV was suppost to be new. I think it was refurb..Broke in a week. trying to return now,
Reviews.Author: J. Michael Prizzi
Reviews.Content: TV was suppost to be new. I think it was refurb..Broke in a week. trying to return now..please make this right!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Gregg Bracke "Calistoga"
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is that it doesn't provide the pairing codes to go with my cable remote other than that is the a great TV for the bedroom

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this TV
Reviews.Author: Wickies mom
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV.  It was very easy to put together and set up (and I am not a tech person).  I find that the picture and sound quality are fine for what I need.

Reviews.Title: terrible
Reviews.Author: Paul Stenseth
Reviews.Content: Picture is alright, but in the day it can be hard to see.  Definitely would go with an LED in the future.  Also, can not hook up surround sound to the tv which is a pain in the rear

Reviews.Title: LG TV
Reviews.Author: Amarantine
Reviews.Content: Just what I was looking for in a television--good size and excellent reception.  However, I had to call my service provider for help with the installation because the instructions regarding the connection of the cables were not accurate.

Reviews.Title: Is ok for the price
Reviews.Author: niurka
Reviews.Content: The image of this tv is not so good compare to my Samsung tv it has a good audio, wouldn't recommend this tv

Reviews.Title: LG 37" HDTV
Reviews.Author: TrueGreen
Reviews.Content: Am very happy with this purchase.Once set up it has a beautiful, bright, clear picture with good sound. It came very well packaged. I set it up on a table top using the stand that comes with the TV. Once set up with the stand, which was fairly easy, it is very sturdy. If you have young children or a pet or there is any possibility it can be knocked over it comes with a screw that allows you to stabilize the TV by attaching it to the desktop with the screw. I had no need for this as it is quite stable without the screw.One suggestion is that if you order this TV also order the component video cables AND the HDMI cable. They are not expensive and are included with the free shipping.I set up the TV with the component video cables first as I had read that this gives the best picture and sound. All I got was snow on screen. I then added a coax cable and this got me a picture. I was then able to get into the menu.This was not a problem with the TV, but with me because I really didn't know how to get into the different modes. I then separately bought an HDMI cable and added that. With the three different cable attachments I was able to compare picture and sound in different modes (using the different cables). I found the HDMI cable gave me the best picture and sound.From there you can play with the different adjustments under whichever mode you chose to use until you personalize the TV to your own taste.I have Verizon FiOS and am able to control the TV with one remote. (The TV comes with it's own remote, but this wouldn't work the set top box). The only problem I had using the FiOS remote was changing the volume when using the HDMI cable (which I eventually stuck with). At first I had to use the LG remote just for the volume. I finally found a trick in the FiOS remote instructions that show a setting to allow use of that remote for setting sound. The FiOS remote did control the sound when using the component video cables.All in all I am extremely happy with this TV and it is a great value for the price. You just need to do a bit of trial and error with the settings until you get the picture and sound you are most happy with. Thus I would suggest setting it up from the start with coax, component and HDMI cables and play around with them. They can all be left in place once you arrive at the settings you want.

Reviews.Title: Move over Sony
Reviews.Author: Christopher Scaife "CS"
Reviews.Content: I have never liked anything but Sony electronics.  From TVs, DVD players, alarm clocks, you name it.  I really like the picture on the LG television and the volume control is excellent.  I really like to be able to finely tune the volume so i can fall asleep to TV and a commercial wont come on and wake me up. My last Sony had about 10 levels, this LG has a lot more.  Again, the picture is great and set up was easy to sync with my Direct TV remote.  The price was awesome, so i think i have found a new favorite brand.

Reviews.Title: A nice, basic TV
Reviews.Author: Belly on Legs "looknsee"
Reviews.Content: This TV had a great sale price, and it was the perfect size for my needs.  I've had an LG TV before, and I was quite satisfied with it.  The picture is very good with saturated colors, but overall, the image is a little dim when viewed in a dark room (compared to a plasma TV).  The controls are intuitive & easy.  Overall, it's a nice, basic TV with a fairly large screen.

Reviews.Title: My 3rd LG purchase
Reviews.Author: LadyDi
Reviews.Content: I now own a 2 37" and one 42" LG tvs.  In general I like the product very much.  Great bargain for the money...The one thing you should know is to check out the details of the MODEL you are buying...You may need a larger number of 'plug ins' for your purposes but other than that it is a great product.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: shokrollah
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about six month ago ... It has been working well and it didn't have any problem. I guess it was a good deal! It is not a full option TV but it is good ...

Reviews.Title: LG 42" LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Richard N. Sautter
Reviews.Content: Well packaged.  Arrived as projected.  I found easy to assemble and set up programmingto view with cable service.  So far I have not found any problems.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: ALAN
Reviews.Content: Great TV excellent picture arrived in one day, sound good easy to set up.Would suggest this TV at this price.

Reviews.Title: Low end LG 37" flat screen TV
Reviews.Author: B. Kendall Berg
Reviews.Content: When it is working, this set has nice performance for the price, however, hdmi performance is a little twitchy (1st set did not work at all, replacement has needed power cycling several times to enable hdmi sound and picture).The set has a setup wizard to guide user through major adjustments.  Neither original set nor the replacement had enough range on contrast to pass the setup wizard's example for white screen, although the picture is clear and bright.Only thanks to Amazon's no questions asked replacement policy can I recommend this set.

Reviews.Title: LG 42-Inch LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Kim L. Erickson
Reviews.Content: Love the new television. Great picture and arrived in just a couple of days. Easy to hook up. This is my first HDTV and now I know what all the talk is about!

Reviews.Title: 1080p on a budget
Reviews.Author: R. Henninger "rational liberal"
Reviews.Content: Great picture, teamed with a Roku and the Leaf indoor antenna, I am able to view plenty of content with a great picture.

Reviews.Title: LG32CS560 32" HDTV
Reviews.Author: Lauri in Hamilton
Reviews.Content: After picking the tv I went to the reviews to see what others thought of this tv. The reviews helped me figure out how to 'lighten up' the picture by turning off the 'power saver' option.The set up was fast and easy.The picture and sound are great. Even better then my Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Best selection
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: What a magnificent picture on my new LG 37 inch LCD HDTV.  I had recently moved from another state and brought with me a still-working old tv.  My friend wondered why I'd paid to have the hulk moved and I said, "because it still worked."  But this new tv is like having the events happening in my own living room because of it's clarity and beauty of color!

Reviews.Title: Great for our second set
Reviews.Author: Lou Fisher
Reviews.Content: I took off a star in deference to those who want a full home theater setup, but 2 hdmi and a component connection were plenty for us as the second set we use in our bedroom or on the enclosed porch. Setup was easy, picture is fine from DVR or Blu-ray, features are appreciated, and where else can you get a quality 1080p set at such a good price.

Reviews.Title: Received new LG 32" HDTV to use as second home TV as well as monitor for new PC also purchased
Reviews.Author: AndrewDS
Reviews.Content: NIce TV; considerably lighter in weight than my current 37" HDTV.  I kinda miss having button controls on the side of the LG (vice my older Panasonic).  Can't turn the TV on or off withought finding the remote.  But price was reasonable and will be a good substitute as a PC Monitor.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: James Mc
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about making such a large purchase online but I am very happy I did. I have not come across any problems and the overall process was quick and easy! The TV is a great quality and has a very crisp picture. Perfect fit for our den at home!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a good price
Reviews.Author: Buggles
Reviews.Content: Overall, I am very satified with this flatscreen considering its reasonable price.  I have only had one other similar sized screen from another manufacturer and the LG seems to have better color and black.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV
Reviews.Author: Chelsey Jensen
Reviews.Content: This TV is great and at a really good price too. The picture is super clear and the size is perfect for my medium sized bedroom. I will likely purchase another LG TV for my living room within the next few months.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Krish
Reviews.Content: Have been using it for the past couple of years. Best 3D TV. My kids love it. Great product from LG

Reviews.Title: Good t.v. and great seller,  but the dark spots in the stem keep me from giving it the extra stars
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: When I first got it i would have put 5  stars.  The person who I bought it from was honest and genuine and I would most certainly purchase goods  from him again.  The tv works and is simple and easy to use.  Unfortunately, a  couple  of weeks after purchase i  began  to see Brown spots  on the screen. While it's nothing more then a minor inconvenience i would have expected more from this particular brand.  It's seems to be a  problem with the led  that does giving it dark spots in  places.  Other then that it was a good buy that was fair priced.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Carol D. Pippin
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture and the sound is good also. I really like it but wish it had more connections in the back, so that I could  hook up a few more things. Otherwise it works great.

Reviews.Title: fine
Reviews.Author: Felix G.
Reviews.Content: Thanks so much for the item, im so happy with it and hope to get more item later. appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Spunky Girl
Reviews.Content: The picture's great, it's easy to use. The only downside is there is only one AV outlet, which has meant we have to route other players through a VCR. Not a big deal, just something to consider.

Reviews.Title: Had it for a year now and its still perfect!
Reviews.Author: Love to Bake! "Baker Boy"
Reviews.Content: GREAT value and works like it was still new.  No problems whatsoever.  The color, resolution, display, everything is crisp and perfect.  It is well used by now but it is as vibrant in resolution as the day it was plugged in.  Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: On/Off Power issue
Reviews.Author: D. Hadley
Reviews.Content: I bought this product in August 2012.  I am now experiencing issue with my power not coming on.  I followed the manual and checked all areas, no joy,  I replaced the power cord and it work for an hour.  Now, I'm sending the TV to a repair shop.

Reviews.Title: incompatible
Reviews.Author: Rater
Reviews.Content: If you're buying this model to use in a college dorm, DON'T!!  I moved my daughter in hooked it up and not good, turns out my first lesson was that colleges create some of their own content and use other equipment to insert channels etc...so, she can't get "some" of the channels, had to take it back and upgrade to better TV.  Cheap is not always the answer, getting what you pay for and all that.

Reviews.Title: It is a big tv.
Reviews.Author: Aleksey Kulichenko
Reviews.Content: I wanted big tv. I got big tv. I am happy with big tv because it has good big tv features and works.

Reviews.Title: Functional Television Displays Images and Emits Sound
Reviews.Author: Alexander Owings
Reviews.Content: This television has performed its stated functions with competency bordering nigh on talent. It displays images with great clarity and smoothness, and emits sounds that, if I hadn't set up a surround sound system before ever attempting to use the television's sound, I'm sure would be wonderful. Unlike most flat screen televisions, I was able to turn this television on without reading the manual ahead of time, which was fortunate because the seller neglected to include a copy of the manual with the television. I should note that the seller also volunteered a $20.00 refund for the lack of the manual when I wrote to suggest that they include a sheet with a link to online manuals for such products. This was unexpected and, I suppose, pleasant in a "I wasn't complaining, but I'm always happy to receive money" sort of way. For anyone who has a similar manual-free shipment experience on LG products, LG publishes all of its product manuals online in .pdf format (I believe with hyperlinks in the table of contents) on its website. So you can find them there.

Reviews.Title: Super impressed with this TV!
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I've never bought a TV online until this one, but I'm glad I did.  First of all, it was delivered to my home WITHIN 24 HOURS!  The TV was easy to set up on the stand.  The picture and sound are both just great.  I was going to connect it to my old sound system, but I don't know if I will since the sound is already pretty awesome.  I don't really know what else I can say about this TV.  Great price, great value!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: andrew3
Reviews.Content: 1080P...what can ya say...it's my office TV now.it does not have two coax inputs so you will have to buy a Diplexer if you have over the air and cable and or satellite.Diplexer is like a splitter except it brings two signals together instead of splitting one signal.The picture is fantastic.My 23 year old son picked it out.I originally bought him two for his games and computer monitors w/tuners.he didn't notice the input issue.But the diplexer is cheap and works perfect with no interference.

Reviews.Title: good t.v. good price
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: this tv is a good price for the size and is good quality as well. samusng makes a better LED t.v.

Reviews.Title: Love this brand of tv
Reviews.Author: dongo465
Reviews.Content: Great picture....this is the third tv purchased in the LG. Just love them. Bought one for mother, she loved mine so we ordered one for her.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Jeanne D. "organizer"
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased for the master bedroom.  I have it mounted on the wall.  It's the perfect size with a great picture!  Very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Doesn't have VGA input.
Reviews.Author: rob h.
Reviews.Content: I was needing a VGA input in order to use it as a monitor.  It was probably my fault for not researching it further before the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great buy for the price!
Reviews.Author: Nish
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV 8 months ago and I am really happy with it! It was a great buy, specially for the price!

Reviews.Title: Geat
Reviews.Author: Wassa
Reviews.Content: We replaced an old tv to get more space. The picture is clear, sound is good and hookup of DVR and bluray were simple.

Reviews.Title: LG 42-inch 1080p60Hz  LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Visa
Reviews.Content: This is a good buy as far as I am concerned. I enjoy this TV to the max.  and I will advise anyone to get it.

Reviews.Title: Never worked... malfunctioned when taken out of the box.
Reviews.Author: Bonnye C. Briggs "Rain Writer"
Reviews.Content: LG television never worked.  When removed from the box there were two holes in the packing material and when plugged into the wall only black screen with large spider web of cracks showed on the screen.  This is a totally non-functioning TV set.  Item is being returned to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Greg Lowen
Reviews.Content: The TV has everything I wanted. The two HDMI ports are convenient. The TV sound is fine, and the visual quality is great.

Reviews.Title: LG TV
Reviews.Author: Carol Plantarich
Reviews.Content: We are enjoying the TV as it is much larger and newer than the one we had been watching.  It is a pleasure to watch it.

Reviews.Title: great for the money
Reviews.Author: Tracey L Allen
Reviews.Content: this tv was great for the money, though I wish I had waited for the holiday sales and gotten an even better price!

Reviews.Title: The USB drive does not support external hard drives
Reviews.Author: Galaxyhiker42
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in order to hook my external harddrive up and watch movies and shows.. as apposed to my normal HDMI to computer. (I wanted to free up my computer a bit so I could work and watch movies etc.)Sadly after many calls to LG and Amazon no one could figure out the problem and I just ended up sending the TV back.LGs customer servers is 5/5 and so is amazons.I know that make good products... this one sadly just did not do what I thought it did.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: ginya
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed.  After having issues with the screen quality after a month's use I was sending it back to Electronic's Express.  When I lifted it to put it to the box it slipped out of my hand due to Parkinson's and fell on a table lamp and then on to the tv cabinet breaking the screen.  After many attempts to try and find someone to help in getting this replaced/fixed or reimbursed all Electronic's Express told me was it wasn't their policy and they were sorry they couldn't help more.This huge TV was a gift from family in Europe and now I don't have one AT ALL AND NO ONE WILL HELP ME.  NOW I AM OUT $350.  I will NEVER purchase anything from Electronic's Express AGAIN.VW~~San Diego

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Dreizle
Reviews.Content: It was a gift and she loved it!. It came right on time for me to setup and surprise her!

Reviews.Title: Just want to share my experience
Reviews.Author: Yuri
Reviews.Content: I bought a NEW TV and I expected to receive a new TV, but I received a defective TV with scratches, NO sound from audio jack and with no opportunity to watch movie via USB.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: William Gibson
Reviews.Content: It's a great TV. Very sharp picture, no problem installing. I would recommend it to my friends. I bought it as a bedroom TV, the only issue is that I wish it had a DVD player on it. Otherwise, it's an excellent  TV.

Reviews.Title: Loving it
Reviews.Author: SATISH
Reviews.Content: Works great. I am using Apple Tv to watch VOD content and have no issues. This is our first hdtv and will continue to use this for a long time. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: TheIrishLegacy

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: H. Nasser "defbee"
Reviews.Content: I have been shopping to replace my 3 years old 42" HDTV LCD TV also 1080p, taking my time reading reviews, checking prices, after two month the LG 42CS560 came out on top, everywhere I look the picture quality is almost 5 out 5, so I decided to buy one, I could've gone for the LG 42CS570 which provide 120Hz vs 60Hz and a $100 more, according to the  experts the 560 will give you the same quality, in fact they both have the same specifications with the exception of the two I mentioned above, the 120hz it's better only for fast sport action like Nascar if your TV is a video camera but it's not. Setup was extremly easy, plug it in, hook up the source of your TV connection, I connected my HDMI cable from the cable box to HDMI1 on back of the TV (Make sure choose on the LG remote your connection input whether HDMI1, HDMI2, RCA cable setup or over the air antena, set the lanuage and the time zone, after that go to setting and choose Picture Wizard it will automatically adjust the TV colors for best setting and it has the intelligent Sensor feature it will also adjust the colors if the lighting is too bright or dark, you never have to adjust the picture, change your audio under setting from standard to cinema , it will give you more powerful detailed sound, then guess what...You are done! I couldn't believe how clear and true the colors are...just superb. Huge difference between my old one and the LG. One final note; I see some reviews posted here but for a different LG models, one review gave it 1 star and it's about his 32" LG TV. This is only about the LG 42CS560 model. Anyways I would definitely recommend this TV to anybody.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, weak speakers 37 inch is good size
Reviews.Author: R. Beaton
Reviews.Content: You see so many 32's I am glad I chose a 37 inch for a medium sized space. Like many of today's TV's the technology has been improved for the picture as the speakers get smaller. Swivel works well. I expected speaker issue, sound bar easily solves weakness. Easy to navigate menu. Quick menu comes in handy and picture and audio is easily adjusted for cinema, talk, music etc.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Mrs. C MB
Reviews.Content: Clear picture, sounds great, looks good, and priced right!!  This is our 3rd LG TV, and this one did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: A very simple product to install
Reviews.Author: Afghan Pete
Reviews.Content: I received this in the evening, a week before it was do.  Opened the box, put it together and 30 minutes later was watching TV.  Only suggestion I have is, if you are not 6-2 like me, get help getting it out of the box and set up.  It is bulky but of course it is 42" so what the hell would you expect?  Customer work is 6 screws to put in for the base.  That is it.  LG has a fantastic products!!

Reviews.Title: For my Mom
Reviews.Author: Raymond Aponte Garcia
Reviews.Content: I got this for my mom after much debate that she should can the old analog TV and modernize. The problem now is that she watches more tv now that ever. Good quality and price.

Reviews.Title: Good tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Drew Ontano
Reviews.Content: This tv is a bit better than what I expected after reading CNET reviews.  The picture and color qualities are pretty good, but the black level is the only weak point.

Reviews.Title: LG 420S560 42-inch1080p60HzLCDHD TV
Reviews.Author: Micky Fichera
Reviews.Content: I love this , it came when they said right on the day , i was really surprised how nice it was easy to set up ,i am very pleased

Reviews.Title: 37" LG TV
Reviews.Author: Jo Burns
Reviews.Content: I have other LG TV's and they work great so I ordered one from Amazon.  It came in great condition and works great!  Love it!

Reviews.Content: Many smaller TV's have less than full 1080p resolution but this one looks just like a big high definition TV; you just have to sit closer. A great TV for a limited space cabinet or in a smaller room.

Reviews.Title: my t.v.
Reviews.Author: Toytoy Beckmann
Reviews.Content: I luv my tv the sound the picture everything was of good quality and very easy to hook -up for a woman.

Reviews.Title: One of the best

Reviews.Content: Excellent TV. Easy set up and operations. Only draw back is the lack of Wi-Fi. On screen set up is a snap.

Reviews.Content: When the Geek Squad came to set up the TV, computer, etc, they said It was an older TV set, that Amazon sometimes does this.  I was disappopinted to hear this, but will keep it as it would be much too difficult to return it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Tad
Reviews.Content: We have really enjoyed this TV that fits perfectly into our old entertainment center.  It works really well with my computer too.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Smokey
Reviews.Content: Great picture, we use it on the lanai and it does very well. we would certainly recommend it. to anyone...

Reviews.Title: Initial thoughts, seems to be perfect.
Reviews.Author: M. Sharpe "Ghostbusters!"
Reviews.Content: This set seems to be perfect for what I need it for, TV and movies. No Netflix, no internet no junk. Simple hook ups on the back, a component input, audio input, 2 HDMI's and a USB which I'll never use. Finish is so nice, piano black. First the only real awful thing about this TV is that the USB is angled to out the side of the set, the HDMI's are not which they really should be.This TV is equipped with an energy saver, the factory apparently sets this at "auto" and the picture was awfully dim. I started playing with all the picture modes and setting and saw where you can turn this off and it makes the display much brighter which how I thought it would be at first. TV looks pretty amazing to me, I haven't seen a movie on it (only in power save mode) it was too dim to judge with that on. I haven't even hooked up an HDMi cable to it.I picture wizard? I didn't get a lot out of it, I just went through it and it looked like everything was where it needed to be, in the recommended setting which was fine. there is an "edge enhancer" which really improves the picture sharpness but makes some of the lines have a white outline to them, this is just on animated programs. So far we haven't watched any live-action movies but I'm willing to bet that they'll look outstanding as well, the Commercials on the TV look amazingly sharp.there is an adjustable setting for just about everything you can think of. Treble, Bass, Balance and you can even turn the speakers off. you can adjust sharpness of course, color, color Temperature (haven't figured that out yet), contrast, Backlight, brightness and etc. there are also Advanced settings like Gamma, Black level, Film mode, things like that. there are many other settings I still have yet to fool with that some people would find very helpful. You can probably download the manual and look at all these online before you buy.I was hoping for a removable power cord because the one supplied is about 4 foot long and the house I live in there is only an outlet about 12 feet away so I have a belkin surge suppressor hooked to it right now. I'll eventually get some else that can go behind the TV and not right in front of the subwoofer (the sub is sitting behind my front left speaker and the surge protector's cord is only 6' long and can't reach all the way to behind the TV.Not very heavy, very easy to put together and move around. you have to put the stand together on the TV, I wouldn't freak out about assembling this, there isn't much to it at all, you can almost look at it and tell how to do it.I am comparing this TV to an older Sanyo CRT and the picture was got to where it was pretty sweet even on it since it had Component video. The picture is sharper on this TV and I can't wait to not only replace the component cable with an HDMI cable. Plus coming from a CRT that weighed a ton this is basically heaven for me.The only thing I don't like is the Energy saver, I mean honestly, why would you buy a TV and have it dimmed all the time and not be able to enjoy to it's fullest extent? We started "it's complicated" the other night and I could not for anything get the picture bright enough then after we had to turn it off I realized this energy saver makes the screen very dark, it's much better without it on at all, although there are a handful of settings for it.UPDATE, still haven't gotten HDMI but to be honest we've only watched a few different things on it so far, King of the Hill, Ice Age and the Rescuers movies and the picture looks close enough to blu-ray. I'll still upgrade to HDMI but if Component video is all you have you'll be happy with that. The player I'm using is a Denon 3910, you may not get this good of picture from a cheaper player through Component video cables, it only 1080i and looks amazing. I'm quite content with the results of this combination. The video is being passed through an older non-HDMI receiver which is used to switch from DVR to DVD player. The cable I'm using is 24' long too, I had it used for a long run around half a small living room. I plan on again getting a much shorter HDMI cable.

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture

Reviews.Content: Nice picture, but sound is delayed to my other TV's so I can hear others in other rooms out of sinc.  Remote is goofy, vol. , mute, and channel change under your hand as you naturally hold it.  Should be where you finger can acess it.  Lot of extra buttons..?  2 steps to get to DVD/VCR. Reviews.Title: very good tv

Reviews.Title: tv for my study

Reviews.Title: Great TV especially for the price
Reviews.Author: Dorthy Russo
Reviews.Content: We purchased this tv to replace one that we had in our bedroom and are very happy with the product. Excellent resolution, good audio quality and the 37" was a perfect size for the space we had - this was important to us and there were not many 37" tv's out there. If watching sports there is some slight blurring in high speed action that was norticible but not a major problem. I think this is due to the fact that it is 60Hz vs the higher priced 120hz but since we rarely watch sports in the bedroom it is not an issue. We are moving into a new house and I will definitely get LG's for all the rooms.

Reviews.Title: Perfect and easy purchase

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: ABecker
Reviews.Content: Great product, sounds average and works as stated. Easy to put together.  Could use an extra sound system if you are looking for quality high sound.

Reviews.Title: Just as reviewed
Reviews.Author: Lynn Rose
Reviews.Content: The other reviews covered the only negatives.  Not enought ports in back, but we don't game so if we need to we can get extra ports.  There are some back lighting and glare issues most from where ours is located near a bow window.  This still has a great picture.

Reviews.Title: as advertised
Reviews.Author: Jim Steadman
Reviews.Content: Arrived safely - easily unpacked and up and operating painlessly. Used daily for cable viewing; used with HDMI video camera direct connected yesterday and it was amazing. We are pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: LG TV

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: Paula Crovatt
Reviews.Content: it definitely met expectations - looking to buy another one, i will definitely keep this in mind for the near future.

Reviews.Title: Great product, Excellent service.

This is our first fancy flat screen TV.  The old monster finally died and we had to step into the 21st century technology.  Highly recommend this purchase.  Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Good picture and no complaints.
Reviews.Author: Whatever
Reviews.Content: I received the tv quickly and it was super easyto set up.  I'm very happy with the picture andsound.  It was a good buy for me!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Barbara Kaye
Reviews.Content: This TV is an excellent product for someone who doesn't want a mammoth TV.  It arrived ahead of time expected. It's very easy to set up, has a vibrant picture, good sound.  Only problem is the remote keys are way too small for stiff old fingers!  The instructions on how to add & delete channels could be more precise also.

Reviews.Title: it doesnt have video playing option through usb
Reviews.Author: Kishore
Reviews.Content: i am not satisfied with this model because it doesnt have video playing option through usb ,but the picture quality was good,three stars is for amazon.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Canton Guy
Reviews.Content: I have several Panasonic plasma TVs. I needed a cheaper TV for a short period where I am living temporarily. It came on time and installed in a zippy. But I am not happy with the picture quality. Lot of motion blurr. I use directv satellite programs. I guess part of the reason is I do not have HD package. Not sure if I needed that with drectv. But, DVD playback is fine. Sound is not really good. If you have the money, get a sound bar around $125 or so if you want to stay low on budget. It worked for me. I just wished the pic quality was a bit better.

Reviews.Title: Bought this for my grandmother
Reviews.Author: Jbog1883 "olympus_mons"
Reviews.Content: When her old tv finally broke.  She seems to like it and have had no reports of any complaints from her....yet.

It's easy to set up; all you need is a screwdriver for the stand or mount. The quality of the picture is excellent. I would definitely recommend this item to anyone looking for an inexpensive bedroom TV with HD capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Great TV

Reviews.Title: over the top...

Reviews.Title: So far, so good...

This includes sports scores and poker hands.  What's up with that?  Everything else is great.  Sound seems better than average, too.

Reviews.Title: I love it

Reviews.Title: Nice TV

Reviews.Content: This is a very, very good TV.I have it in my bed room and it play very well.THANK YOU !!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV

I have this mounted on my wall, and the only issue I have is that when I turn the TV to one side, the power cord comes out a little and the TV turns off until I fully plug the cord back in.  So far I am fully satisfied with this TV.  Great price for this size and this quality.

Reviews.Title: excellent

Reviews.Content: i love it, it was just as described. than you again for a good product. will buy again from you.

Reviews.Content: It worked fine, arrived on time, and was not damaged in transit.It worked fine, arrived on time, and was not damaged in transit.

Reviews.Title: TV ROCKS
Reviews.Author: Liquid20
Reviews.Content: This HDTV is absolutely worth every penny.  I got this specifically to use with my computer as my main monitor.  If you aren't all techy and are looking for a good, quick response, just great TV for gaming or whatever this tv will do fine.  Lower cost, great quality, just be sure to read specs before you order to make sure it will do what you need it to.  O and btw i used a mini hdmi to hdmi cable to connect my Geforce GTX560ti to it. Reviews.Title: 42 inch TV

Reviews.Content: I don't have a bad word to say about this whole transaction.  The TV is great everything they said it would be. No problem with the shipment.  You can't go wrong buying this TV....anyway I had no problems.

It is not.

Reviews.Title: happy with tv
